thread.title: Dollar Bulls Cursed Again as Retail Sales Figures Trail Forecast
thread.title_full: Dollar Bulls Cursed Again as Retail Sales Figures Trail Forecast - Bloomberg Business

author: Andrea Wong
title: Dollar Bulls Cursed Again as Retail Sales Figures Trail Forecast
text:
American consumers are once again standing in the way of dollar bulls.
The greenback slid Tuesday as a government report showed an unexpected drop in U.S. retail sales in June. The report has been the dollar's bane this year, trailing economists' forecasts in all except one month in 2015.
Dimmed optimism about the economy is bad news for investors hoping the dollar will resume its rally. The Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index rose 20 percent from June 2014 through March on bets the Federal Reserve will boost interest rates at a time when central banks in Europe, Japan, and China are pursuing simulative monetary policies.
The trade came to a halt in March amid signs of restrained inflation and as Fed policy makers signaled a gradual approach to raising the central bank's benchmark rate from virtually zero.
Retail sales ``disappoints every single month,'' Douglas Borthwick, head of foreign exchange at New York brokerage Chapdelaine & Co., said by phone. ``As long as the Fed keeps rates unchanged, that divergence trade starts to give up.''
